comments.body: Does this actually fix the handling of default-valued field updates when the object gets re-marshalled?

This particular line does not but the PR does :). Check out merge_test.go. Just to be sure i've added some test to helper_test.go as well. See
https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/4448/files#diff-c8e282cc368fe38828935844bb3bd00aR113
which delete's a field and
https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/4448/files#diff-c8e282cc368fe38828935844bb3bd00aR133
which updates an int field to zero. default-value updates are fixed by applying patch json directly to versioned type json.

I think I see why you put the comment on this line. On the trip back to the server are the default fields wiped out? I believe they still are if the field is annotated with omitempty. For that we would have to eliminate conversion round trip in kubectl.
Or implement HTTP PATCH on our resource endpoints.

Thanks for clarifying, I just wanted to double check that this wasn't supposed to be fixing everything we talked about in the comments of #4008, just the original issue.

I got interrupted last night when going through this, I'll check out the rest now.
